title: Provide Functionality For Bridge2AI Dashboard(s)
text: NIH Common Fund’s Bridge Artificial Intelligence (Bridge2AI) program propel biomedical research forward setting stage widespread adoption artificial intelligence (AI) tackles complex biomedical challenges beyond human intuition. key step process generating new “flagship” data sets best practices machine learning analysis. Machine learning type Artificial Intelligence (AI) provides machines (like computers) ability automatically learn improve experience, without explicitly programmed. biomedical research community generates wealth data, data suitable machine learning incomplete. bringing technological biomedical experts together social scientists humanists, Bridge2AI program help bring solutions deficit : Generating new flagship biomedical behavioral data sets ethically sourced, trustworthy, well-defined, accessible Developing software standards unify data attributes across multiple data sources across data types Creating automated tools accelerate creation FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) ethically sourced data sets Providing resources disseminate data, ethical principles, tools, best practices Creating training materials activities workforce development bridges AI, biomedical, behavioral research communities

what: Get a ORCID work detail — orcid_work_detail
title: Get a ORCID work detail — orcid_work_detail
text: ORCID API concept work dedicated API endpoint. function calls endpoint returns single data.frame row representing work.

title: Get a ORCID work detail — orcid_work_detail
Get a ORCID work detail — orcid_work_detail
text: orcid character(1) orcid required put_code integer(1) put-code, ORCID API internal identifier work

title: Get a ORCID work detail — orcid_work_detail
text: Additional functionality available work record bibtex entry. Using rbibutils package, one can convert citation bibtex, latex, citations various styles, even HTML.

title: Get a ORCID work detail — orcid_work_detail
code:
orcid = '0000-0001-5643-4068' put_code = 89488980 df = orcid_work_detail(orcid, put_code) df #> orcid put_code created_at updated_at #> 1 0000-0001-5643-4068 89488980 2021-02-25 18:56:13 2022-05-31 22:54:57 #> citation_type #> 1 bibtex #> citation_value #> 1 @article{PMID:31995185, title = {Refgenie: a reference genome resource manager.}, author = {Stolarczyk M and Reuter VP and Smith JP and Magee NE and Sheffield NC}, doi = {10.1093/gigascience/giz149}, journal = {GigaScience}, month = {02}, year = {2020} } #> work_type contributors url #> 1 journal-article NA http://europepmc.org/abstract/med/31995185 #> doi pmid pmc abstract #> 1 10.1093/gigascience/giz149 31995185 PMC6988606 NA colnames(df) #> [1] "orcid" "put_code" "created_at" "updated_at" #> [5] "citation_type" "citation_value" "work_type" "contributors" #> [9] "url" "doi" "pmid" "pmc" #> [13] "abstract" # the bibtex entry, if available, # can be used for additional manipulation if(require('rbibutils')) { rref = rbibutils::charToBib(df$citation_value) print(rref) # bibtex print(rref, style = "Bibtex") # simple citation print(rref, style = "citation") # html print(rref, style = "html") # latex print(rref, style = "latex") # r citation print(rref, style = "R") } #> Loading required package: rbibutils #> M S, VP R, JP S, NE M, NC S (2020). “Refgenie: a reference genome #> resource manager.” _GigaScience_. doi:10.1093/gigascience/giz149 #> , #> . #> @Article{PMID:31995185, #> author = {Stolarczyk M and Reuter VP and Smith JP and Magee NE and Sheffield NC}, #> title = {Refgenie: a reference genome resource manager.}, #> journal = {GigaScience}, #> year = {2020}, #> month = {Feb}, #> doi = {10.1093/gigascience/giz149}, #> url = {https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giz149}, #> } #> #> M S, VP R, JP S, NE M, NC S (2020). “Refgenie: a reference genome #> resource manager.” _GigaScience_. doi:10.1093/gigascience/giz149 #> , #> . #> #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #> #> @Article{PMID:31995185, #> author = {Stolarczyk M and Reuter VP and Smith JP and Magee NE and Sheffield NC}, #> title = {Refgenie: a reference genome resource manager.}, #> journal = {GigaScience}, #> year = {2020}, #> month = {Feb}, #> doi = {10.1093/gigascience/giz149}, #> url = {https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giz149}, #> } #> #> #> #>

M S, VP R, JP S, NE M, NC S (2020). #> “Refgenie: a reference genome resource manager.” #> GigaScience. #> doi:10.1093/gigascience/giz149, https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giz149. #>

#> M S, VP R, JP S, NE M, NC S (2020). #> ``Refgenie: a reference genome resource manager.'' #> \emph{GigaScience}. #> \Rhref{https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giz149}{doi:10.1093\slash{}gigascience\slash{}giz149}, \url{https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giz149}. #> bibentry(bibtype = "Article", #> key = "PMID:31995185", #> author = c(person(given = "Stolarczyk", #> family = "M"), #> person(given = "Reuter", #> family = "VP"), #> person(given = "Smith", #> family = "JP"), #> person(given = "Magee", #> family = "NE"), #> person(given = "Sheffield", #> family = "NC")), #> title = "Refgenie: a reference genome resource manager.", #> journal = "GigaScience", #> year = "2020", #> month = "Feb", #> doi = "10.1093/gigascience/giz149", #> url = "https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giz149")
